The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them was solely revenge from an unseen creature from thousands of years ago.

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a cinema before. How was Curse? Is it much worse than we were expecting? My mum was considering watching this week, with approximately no Bluray/DVD releases next week she's probably going for it now. Yeah curse is pretty bad I loved the first 1 massively but these two are just rushed cash grabs.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent world. In the episode, titled MEAN SOCCER WEEK, Calamity cleans during busy time at his dad's cafe so he can listen to his favorite jockey (he listens rather than works) Sometimes cut into films with a "MORAL" of some kind.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it was decent film fest fodder and enjoyable enough to sit through thanks to alotg of fun gags.
Considered one of Fleischer’s films this may be. I think it’s a pratical source for inspiration as much as that.
The previous found footage slasher Grindhouse feature deserves all the praise

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film.
